gw.api.domain.invoice

Class DateNudger

  • java.lang.Object
    • gw.api.domain.invoice.DateNudger

  • public class DateNudger
extends java.lang.Object
    A DateNudger is a Function that nudges one date to another date. It also provides information about the maximum number of days it will nudge a date to be earlier or later.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static DateNudger createFrom(DayOfMonthLogic dayOfMonthLogic)
      Creates a new DateNudger from the given DayOfMonthLogic.

      Creates a new DateNudger from the given DayOfMonthLogic.
      int maximumDaysOfNudge() 
      org.joda.time.DateTime nudge(org.joda.time.DateTime unnudgedDate)
      Uses the Function or DayOfMonthLogic provided at creation time to nudge the given date.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • createFrom

        public static DateNudger createFrom(DayOfMonthLogic dayOfMonthLogic)
        Creates a new DateNudger from the given DayOfMonthLogic. The maximum number of days the DateNudger will move a date is set to 10.
        Parameters:
        dayOfMonthLogic - logic to use for this DateNudger
        Returns:
        newly created DateNudger

      • createFrom

        public static DateNudger createFrom(int maximumDaysOfNudge,
                    com.google.common.base.Function<org.joda.time.DateTime,org.joda.time.DateTime> nudgingFunction)
        Creates a new DateNudger from the given DayOfMonthLogic.
        Parameters:
        maximumDaysOfNudge - limit on the number of days the DateNudger will move a date
        nudgingFunction - Function to nudge the original date
        Returns:
        newly created DateNudger

      • nudge

        public org.joda.time.DateTime nudge(@Nullable
                           org.joda.time.DateTime unnudgedDate)
        Uses the Function or DayOfMonthLogic provided at creation time to nudge the given date. If no date is given, nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        unnudgedDate - date to nudge
        Returns:
        date nudged by the provided Function or DayOfMonthLogic

      • maximumDaysOfNudge

        public int maximumDaysOfNudge()
        Returns:
        the maximum number of days the DateNudger will move dates. If no date is given during creation of the DateNudger the default is 10.
